	U.S. dollars in thousands (except of share and per share data)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z67E25CD3017B4D4FAD4F37FD6A2FAB6B" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 56.7PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	NOTE 3:-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING JUDGMENTS, ESTIMATES AND ASSUMPTIONS USED IN THE PREPARATION OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Cont.)
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The assumptions used in the models include the expected volatility, early exercise factor, expected dividend and risk-free interest rate.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZCCB1154AD7B04064A6DF9CC091E1708B" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Liabilities in respect to Israeli Innovation Authority grants:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Government grants received from the Israeli Innovation Authority are recognized as a liability if future economic benefits are expected from the research and development activity that will result in royalty&#8209;bearing sales. As the contingent liability is calculated based on future royalty-bearing sales,&#160; there is uncertainty regarding the estimated future cash flows and the estimated discount rate used to measure the amortized cost of the liability.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZF729D58DF08446FBB9752FEA6968E7F3" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Contingent consideration for the purchase of treasury shares:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Contingent consideration for acquisition of treasury shares was first measured at fair value. After initial recognition, the liability is measured at amortized cost using the effective interest method. As the contingent consideration is calculated based on future royalty&#8209;bearing sales, there is uncertainty regarding the estimated future cash flows and the estimated discount rate used to measure the fair value of this liability.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z9406FBABE72747D3A2FF03323FB3CA71" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Legal claims:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In estimating the likelihood of outcome of legal claims filed against the Company and its investees, the companies rely on the opinion of their legal counsel. These estimates are&#160;based on the legal counsel's best professional judgment, taking into account the stage of proceedings and legal precedents in respect of the different issues. Since the outcome of the claims will be determined in courts, the results could differ from these estimates.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z26C2D260C772486CB8B980AF2B6797F8" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 56.7PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	NOTE 4:-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	DISCLOSURE OF NEW STANDARDS IN THE PERIOD PRIOR TO THEIR ADOPTION
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z1EF863C035FD4DDFB263AAC60ECF610B" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	IFRS 15, "Revenue from Contracts with Customers":
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	IFRS 15 ("the new Standard") was issued by the IASB in May 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The new Standard replaces IAS 18, "Revenue", IAS 11, "Construction Contracts", IFRIC 13, "Customer Loyalty Programs", IFRIC 15, "Agreements for the Construction of Real Estate", IFRIC 18, "Transfers of Assets from Customers" and SIC-31, "Revenue - Barter Transactions Involving Advertising Services".
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The new Standard introduces a five-step model that will apply to revenue earned from contracts with customers:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Step 1:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Identify the contract with a customer
</FONT>
	, including reference to contract combination and accounting for contract modifications.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	F - 18
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage142"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	MEDIWOUND&#160;LTD. AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<HR STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ALIGN="CENTER" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	U.S. dollars in thousands (except of share and per share data)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z3C6270E5D0A34FE8BB7D70C209958E5D" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 56.7PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	NOTE 4:-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	DISCLOSURE OF NEW STANDARDS IN THE PERIOD PRIOR TO THEIR ADOPTION (Cont.)
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Step 2:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Identify the separate performance obligations in the contract
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Step 3:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Determine the transaction price
</FONT>
	, including reference to variable consideration, financing components that are significant to the contract, non-cash consideration and any consideration payable to the customer.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Step 4:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Allocate the transaction price to the separate performance obligations
</FONT>
	on a relative stand-alone selling price basis using observable information, if it is available, or using estimates and assessments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Step 5:
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Recognize revenue when a performance obligation
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	is satisfied,
</FONT>
	either at a point in time or over time.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The new Standard is to be applied retrospectively for annual periods beginning on January 1, 2018. Early adoption is permitted.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	At this stage, the Company does not intend to adopt IFRS 15 early.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The new Standard allows the option of modified retrospective adoption with certain reliefs according to which the new Standard will be applied to existing contracts from the initial period of adoption and thereafter with no restatement of comparative data. Under this option, the Company will recognize the cumulative effect of the initial adoption of the new Standard as an adjustment to the opening balance of retained earnings (or another component of equity, as applicable) as of the date of initial application. Alternatively, the new Standard permits full retrospective adoption with certain reliefs.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	At this stage, the Company is evaluating the different options for adoption of the new Standard.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Company generates revenues from&#160;direct and idirect sales of its products and from license agreements with its distributors. The Company has begun preparations for the adoption of the new Standard on the effective date and is assessing its potential impact on
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	its financial statements as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z96D904932A6243E1BDA4DA101AF0CF2A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 85.05PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Revenue from the sale of goods:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 113.4PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In contracts with customers where the sale of goods is expected to be the only performance obligation, the Company expects to recognize revenue at a point in time when the control of the goods is transferred to the customer, normally when the goods are delivered to the customer. This is similar to the timing of revenue recognition in accordance with current accounting standards.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z067090B425BD4B528C93DF20CA05762C" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 85.05PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Revenue from distribution agreements with multiple-element:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 113.4PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	According to the new Standard, entities need to determine whether the licenses for intellectual property is distinct from other goods and services included in the contract. After determining that a licence of IP is distinct, an entity has to analyse whether the licence is either a right to access the IP or a right to use the IP. Revenue allocated to a licence that conveys a right to access will be recognised over the licence period. Revenue allocated to a licence that conveys a right to use will be recognised when the licence is granted. The new Standard establishes criteria and guidance for making such an assessments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	F - 19
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage143"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	MEDIWOUND&#160;LTD. AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<HR STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ALIGN="CENTER" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	U.S. dollars in thousands (except of share and per share data)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZEE4BFDEAED064614B03414500D9F7E9E" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 56.7PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	NOTE 4:-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	DISCLOSURE OF NEW STANDARDS IN THE PERIOD PRIOR TO THEIR ADOPTION (Cont.)
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 113.4PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 113.4PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	An analysis of the Company's contracts with its distributers indicates that in the majority of contracts, the Company grants its distributers a right to access its intellectual property as it exists throughout the license period. Accordingly, the Company is expected to recognize revenue from the granting of licenses over the license period, which is identical to the current accounting treatment.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 113.4PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In addition, in accordance with terms of some license agreements, the Company is entitled for up-front payments which are accounted for as deferred revenues and recognized in profit and loss over the license period.&#160; Currently the Company does not recognize finance expenses in respect of deferred revenues and therefore the amount of revenues recognized over time is equal to&#160;the amount of payment. According to the new standard, when long-term advances (exceeding one year) are received for a future service, the Company is required to accrue interest and recognize finance expense on the advances over the period of the contract, provided that the contract contains a significant financing component, as this term is defined in the new standard. The Company is still evaluating the effect on the above on its financial statements, but it believes at this stage that this effect, if any, is not expected to be material.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z376DFED9EFCC4A888AE1483A5C2A8A35" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 85.05PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Disclosure and presentation:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 113.4PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The new Standard introduces more detailed and extensive disclosure and presentation requirements than under existing standards. The Company has begun evaluating the need for adjustments to its systems, internal control, policies and procedures that will be necessary in order to gather the information underlying the disclosures.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	After having evaluated the effects of the application of the new Standard as described above, the Company believes that the adoption is not expected to have a material effect on the Company's financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZAFD98017A7F942D38C080C5E6AA61BA8" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	IFRS 16, "Leases":
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In January 2016, the IASB issued IFRS 16, "Leases" ("the new Standard"). According to the new Standard, a lease is a contract, or part of a contract, that conveys the right to use an asset for a period of time in exchange for consideration.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	According to the new Standard, lessees are required to recognize an asset and a corresponding liability in the statement of financial position in respect of all leases (except in certain cases) similar to the accounting treatment of finance leases according to the existing IAS 17, "Leases".Lessees are required to initially recognize a lease liability for the obligation to make lease payments and a corresponding right-of-use asset. Lessees will also recognize interest and depreciation expense separately.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	F - 20
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage144"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	MEDIWOUND&#160;LTD. AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<HR STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ALIGN="CENTER" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	U.S. dollars in thousands (except of share and per share data)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z63F1DB081063426FA5719335BDB8AD16" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 56.7PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	NOTE 4:-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	DISCLOSURE OF NEW STANDARDS IN THE PERIOD PRIOR TO THEIR ADOPTION (Cont.)
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The new Standard is effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2019. Early adoption is permitted provided that IFRS 15, "Revenue from Contracts with Customers", is applied concurrently.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	For leases existing at the date of transition, the new Standard permits lessees to use either a full retrospective approach, or a modified retrospective approach, with certain transition relief whereby restatement of comparative data is not required.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Company believes that the new Standard is not expected to have a material impact on the financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35PT">
	c.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;IFRS&#160;9-Financial Instruments:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In July 2014, the IASB issued the final version of&#160; IFRS 9 Financial Instruments which reflects all phases of the financial instruments project and replaces IAS 39 Financial Instruments: Recognition and Measurement and allprevious versions of IFRS 9. The standard introduces new requirements for classification and measurement, impairment, and hedge accounting. IFRS 9 is effective for annual periods beginning on or after 1 January 2018, with early application permitted.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<DIV>
	The adoption of IFRS 9 will have no material effect on the Company&#8217;s financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">

</FONT>
</DIV>

	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM" COLSPAN="2" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Company is committed to pay royalties to the IIA up to the total grants received plus the applicable accrued interest. The total amount of grants actually received by the Company from the IIA including accrued LIBOR interest, net of royalties actually paid by the Company as of December&#160;31, 2016 is approximately $&#160;12,718, while the amortized cost of this liability as of that date is approximately $&#160;6,888, using the interest method.
</DIV>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Financial risk factors:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Company's activities expose it to various market risks (mainly foreign currency risk and interest rate risk). The Company's Board of Directors has provided guidelines for risk management and specific policies for various risk exposures.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 113.4PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35PT">
<U>
	Foreign currency risk
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Company operates primarily in an international environment and is exposed to foreign exchange risk resulting from the fact that a certain portion of the Company's costs are denominated in NIS and Euros, mainly due to payroll and related benefit costs incurred in Israel and in Europe, and additionally due to marketing expenses incurred in Europe.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z6D0B0CD10D814A84A9985182986C4387" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">

</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The carrying amount of cash and cash equivalents, short&#8209;term bank deposits, trade and other receivables and others payables approximates their fair value due to the short&#8209;term maturities of such instruments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The fair value of liabilities in respect to government grants with fixed interest is based on a calculation of the present value of the cash flows at the interest rate for a loan with similar terms. The Company used a discount rate of 12% based in part of the Company's estimation at the time of the Company's initial recognition of the IIA grants which approximates the fair value at the respective balance sheet date.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The fair value of the contingent consideration in respect of the purchase of treasury shares is based on a calculation of the present value of future royalty payments using a discount rate that reflects the applicable market rate of interest at the date of the initial recognition. The Company used a discount rate of 16% based in part on the Company's estimation, at the time of the Company's initial recognition of the contingent consideration. The amount and timing of the future royalty payments are based on the Company's projected revenues.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZBF66F5A68885467DB8A0935BCB55CFA3" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Sensitivity tests relating to changes in market factors:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Company operates in an international environment and is exposed to foreign exchange risk resulting from the exposure to different currencies, mainly NIS and EURO. Foreign exchange risks arise from recognized assets and liabilities denominated in a foreign currency other than the functional currency.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Sensitivity tests and principal work assumptions:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The selected changes in the relevant risk variables were determined based on management's estimate as to reasonable possible changes in these risk variables.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Company has performed sensitivity tests of principal market risk factors that may affect its reported operating results or financial position.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The sensitivity tests present the profit or loss for the relevant risk variable chosen as of each reporting date.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZF0A42039675D4B7197F5E1BBE3AF73BE" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 54PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	NOTE 14:-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;SEVERANCE PAY LIABILTY, NET
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Company's liability for employee benefits is based on local laws, valid labor agreements, the employee's salary and the applicable terms of employment, which together generate a right to severance compensation. Post&#8209;employment employee benefits are partially financed by deposits with defined contribution plans, as detailed below.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Israeli Severance Pay Law, 1963 ("Severance Pay Law"), specifies that Israeli employees are entitled to severance payment, following the termination of their employment. Under the Severance Pay Law, the severance payment is calculated as one month salary for each year of employment, or a portion thereof.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The majority of the Company's liability for severance pay is covered by Section&#160;14 of the Severance Pay Law ("Section&#160;14"). Under Section&#160;14, employees are entitled to have monthly deposits, at a rate of 8.33% of their monthly salary, made on their behalf to their insurance funds. Payments in accordance with Section&#160;14 release the Company from the liability for any future severance payments in respect of those employees. As a result, the Company does not recognize any liability for severance pay due to these employees and the deposits under Section&#160;14 are not recorded as an asset in the Company's balance sheet. These contributions for compensation represent defined contribution plans.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	F - 27
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">

<A NAME="eolPage151"></A>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	MEDIWOUND&#160;LTD. AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<HR STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ALIGN="CENTER" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	U.S. dollars in thousands (except of share and per share data)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZE10CA14E355C4A3284E8DD4E107283D3" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 54PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	NOTE 15:-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;CONTINGENT LIABILITIES AND COMMITMENTS
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z84CBDDC5946E43B382BE66B6E278EC05" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	In 2000, the Company signed an exclusive license agreement (as amended in 2007) with a third party with regard to its patents and intellectual property. Pursuant to the agreement, the Company received an exclusive license to use the third party's patents and intellectual property, for the purpose of developing, manufacturing, marketing, and commercializing products for treatment of burns and other wounds.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In consideration for this exclusive license, the Company paid an aggregate amount of $&#160;950 following the achievement of certain development milestones as set forth in the agreement. In addition, the Company undertook to pay royalties of 1.5% to 2.5% from future revenues from sales of products which are based on this patent for a period ranging between 10 to 15&#160;years from the first commercial delivery in a major country, and thereafter the Company will have a fully paid-up royalty-free license for these patents. In addition, royalties will be paid at the rate of 10%&#160;-&#160;20% from sub-licensing of such patents. Moreover, the Company agreed to pay a one-time lump-sum amount of $&#160;1,500 when the aggregate revenues based on these patents reach $&#160;100,000. The total amount of royalty payments paid as of December&#160;31, 2016 is approximately $&#160;72.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZE54B8DABDC624C2C9D1CA1873888C18E" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Under the Research and Development Law, (the "R&amp;D Law") the Company undertook to pay royalties of 3%&#160;-&#160;3.5% on the revenues derived from sales of products or services developed in whole or in part using these Israeli Innovation Authority grants. The maximum aggregate royalties paid generally cannot exceed 100% of the grants received by the Company, plus annual interest generally equal to the 12-month LIBOR applicable to dollar deposits, as published on the first business day of each calendar year. The maximum royalty amount payable by the Company as of December&#160;31, 2016 is approximately $&#160;12,718, which represents the total amount of grants actually received by the Company from the Israeli Innovation Authority including accrued interest, net of royalties actually paid by the Company,( see also Note 12).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z419A7F891D944ECFBC92609BF95FB6B4" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	On November&#160;24, 2010, the Company signed an agreement with one of its shareholders, to purchase a patent for the production and sale of related products for the treatment of burns. In consideration for the transfer and assignment of all rights and title relating to the patent, the Company paid a one-time payment in the amount of $&#160;88 and undertook to pay annual fixed payments in the amount of $&#160;30 as long as the patent is valid in the US and/or in any EU member country. The patent expires in May 2018, and the Company's accumulated outstanding obligation with respect to this agreement as of December&#160;31, 2016 is $&#160;43.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z250685AF07F14946AA0912E2647D1210" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	d.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	On September 15, 2014, a Statement of Claim was filed against the Company by some shareholders of Polyheal. The plaintiffs allege that the Company is obligated to pay them a total amount of $1,475 in exchange for their respective portion of PolyHeal's shares, following the commencement of a feasibility study for the next generation of the PolyHeal Product in November 15, 2012, which constituted a milestone under a buyout option agreement between the Company, PolyHeal and its shareholders. For further details, see note 19.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<HR STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ALIGN="CENTER" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z72CBF8E6261C4BE2ADC617CDBE7E1DD3" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>

	NOTE 15:-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;CONTINGENT LIABILITIES AND COMMITMENTS (Cont.)
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	On December 14, 2014, the Company filed its Petition for a Right to Defend, or the Petition, in which it: (i) rejected the arguments raised against it in the Statement of Claim; (ii) emphasized that its obligation under the 2010 PolyHeal Agreement to purchase the 7.5% of PolyHeal&#8217;s shares is subject to the consumption of the deferred closing, as defined in the buyout agreement, including the receipt of the funds from Teva on a &#8220;back to back&#8221; basis; and (iii) stated that since no such payment has been made by Teva, the Company is not subject to any obligation to purchase PolyHeal shares and/or make any payments to PolyHeal&#8217;s shareholders.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	A hearing in the Company's Petition was held on February 16, 2015, in which the Court accepted the Company's Petition and allowed it to file a statement of defense. The Company filed the statement of defense on July 6, 2015. A preliminary hearing took place on February 10, 2016. On June 21, 2016, both parties presented their oral summaries before the Court. As of December 31, 2016, ruling has not yet been given.
</FONT>
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Based on advise from its external legal counsels the Company believes that it has substansive defenses against the claim. Accordingly, no provision was recorded in respect of this claim.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company's offices and its production facility in Israel are located in a building that the Company leases from its Parent Company, in accordance with a sub-lease agreement from July 2004. The sub-lease agreement has been amended multiple times, most recently in September 2016. According to the most recently amended sub lease agreement, the Company subleases approximately 1,205 square meters of laboratory, office and clean room space at a monthly rent fee of $56. This sub-lease agreement expires in December&#160;2017. The Company's subsidiary offices are located in Germany. The monthly rent fee&#160; is currently &#8364;2,800 (approximately $&#160;3.1) and the lease agreement expires on April&#160;30, 2019.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZBA495016588D4B91BD82DC3491F803BD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	&#160;EQUITY
</DIV>
</TD>

</TABLE>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z923C459138DF45738B11231EC55B3E16" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Share capital
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	On March 3, 2014, the Company effected a bonus share distribution under which: (i) two and eight tenths (2.8) bonus shares were issued for each ordinary share outstanding prior to such distribution; and (ii) the conversion rate for each preferred share, option and warrant was adjusted to reflect such bonus share distribution. For accounting purposes, this transaction was recorded as a stock split and accordingly (unless otherwise noted), all ordinary shares, options, warrants and earnings (losses) per share amounts have been adjusted retroactively for all periods presented in these financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z76F60F9597D4422995829D555B10B661" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	b.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PX; DISPLAY: INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH: 18PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Rights attached to shares:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	An ordinary share confers upon its holder(s) a right to vote at the general meeting, a right&#160;&#160; to participate in distribution of dividends, and a right to participate in the distribution of surplus assets upon liquidation of the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z8BA4AA58922B49AEA1C33606C5F2AE0C" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	c.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PX; DISPLAY: INLINE-BLOCK; WIDTH: 18PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	On March 25, 2014 the Company completed its initial public offering in the United States and listing on the NASDAQ Global Select Market&#160; of 5,750,000 new ordinary shares at $14 per share including the underwriters' option to purchase an additional 750,000 shares at the offering price that was exercised prior to closing. The Company's total proceeds from the issuance of the above shares were $71,691 thousands, net of underwriter&#8217;s discount and issuance expenses in the amount of $ 8,809.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZC8248F4C7EB7416581D6B7B7C3B97DB0" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Upon the closing of the IPO, the Company issued 336,591 ordinary shares pursuant to the exercise of 1,066,735 warrants held by certain of the Company shareholders, including (1) the exercise of 433 warrants into 433 ordinary shares at an exercise price of $6.72 per share and the receipt of proceeds by us related to such exercise and (2) the cashless exercise of 1,066,302 warrants into 336,158 ordinary shares at a weighted average exercise price of $9.58 per share.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.75PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	d.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Transactions between the Company and Teva:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Beginning in 2007, the Company entered into a number of agreements with Teva related to collaboration in the development, manufacturing and commercialization of solutions for the burn and chronic wound care markets. In consideration for these agreements, Teva made investments in the Company's ordinary shares and agreed to fund certain research and development expenses and manufacturing costs and perform all marketing activities for both NexoBrid, under the 2007 Teva Agreement, and the PolyHeal Product, under the 2010 PolyHeal Agreements. As of December 31, 2012, all of these agreements terminated.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	On September 2, 2013, in accordance with the terms of the Teva Shareholders&#8217; Rights Agreement, the Company exercised its rights to repurchase all of its shares held by Teva, and purchased 755,492 ordinary shares, in consideration for an obligation to pay Teva future royalty payments of 20% of the Company&#8217;s revenues from the sale or license of NexoBrid resulting in royalty payments up to a total amount of $30.6 million and from the sale or license of the PolyHeal Product resulting in royalty payments up to a total amount of $10.8 million. The obligation to pay Teva future royalty payments no longer includes amounts from the sale or license of the PolyHeal Product since the license to the PolyHeal Product has expired.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	F - 30
</FONT>
</DIV>

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage154"></A>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	MEDIWOUND&#160;LTD. AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<HR STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ALIGN="CENTER" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	U.S. dollars in thousands (except of share and per share data)
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZC3C9252AAE214218805A79DB2776AEC8" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 54PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	NOTE 16:-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;EQUITY (Cont.)
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The total amortized cost of the future royalty obligation to Teva were initially account at their estimated fair value at the exercise date on September&#160;2, 2013 , calculated using a discounted cash flow model based on sales projections at $&#160;19,200. In accordance with IAS&#160;32, the Company recorded the fair value of the liability to pay royalties against a reduction in equity (treasury shares). Subsequent changes in this liability will be recorded in profit or loss within financial (income)/ expenses. Accordingly, the liability was remeasured to $&#160;16,475&#160; and $14,533 as of December&#160;31, 2015 and 2016, respectivaly, as a result of a revaluation in the amount of $ 764 and $ 1,621, respectively, which was recorded within financial income (expenses).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	On June 12, 2014, the Company effected a cancellation of the repurchased 755,492 Ordinary Shares nominal value NIS 0.01, which were considered dormant while held by the Company as treasury shares. Following the cancellation of the shares the entire balance of these treasury shares was reclassified into share capital and premium within equity.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Company has reserved for issuance stock options a total of 2,831,143 ordinary shares. As of December&#160;31, 2016, 650,068 ordinary shares of the Company were still available for future grant. Any options, which are forfeited or not exercised before expiration, become available for future grants.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Options granted under the Company's 2003 Israeli Share Option Plan ("Plan") are exercisable in accordance with the terms of the Plan, within 10&#160;years from the date of grant, against payment of an exercise price. The options generally vest over a period of three or four years.
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In March 2014, the Company adopted and obtained shareholder approval for its 2014 Equity Incentive Plan (the &#8220;2014 Plan&#8221;). Options granted under the Company's 2014 Plan are exercisable in accordance with the terms of the Plan, within 10&#160;years from the date of grant, against payment of an exercise price. The options generally vest over a period of three or four years.
</DIV>

	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z8BEF3E6C69194E1598FEBAEAD5E85536" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z92B1A09749E84831A6F7FA7511A26B0D" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 54PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	NOTE 18:-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;TAXES ON INCOME (Cont.)
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In December 2016, the Israeli Parliament approved the Economic Efficiency Law (Legislative Amendments for Applying the Economic Policy for the 2017 and 2018 Budget Years), 2016 which reduces the corporate income tax rate to 24% (instead of 25%) effective from January 1, 2017 and to 23% effective from January 1, 2018.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z462F5552516F4BB3A7EA0A23C151D13E" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#160;Tax benefits under the Israel Law for the Encouragement of Capital Investments, 1959 (the "Investment Law"):
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Under the Investment Law, the Company has been granted "Beneficiary Enterprise" status which provides certain benefits, including tax exemptions and reduced tax rates. Income not eligible for Beneficiary Enterprise benefits is taxed at a regular rate.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	During the benefit period, the Company will be tax exempt in the first two years of the benefit period and subject to tax at the reduced rate of 10%- 25% for an additional period of five to eight years (depending on the percentage of foreign investments in the Company) of the benefit period. The benefit entitlement period starts from the first year that the Beneficiary Enterprise first earned taxable income, and is limited to 12&#160;years from the year in which the Company requested to have tax benefits apply. In the event of distribution of dividends from the said tax exempt income, the amount distributed will be subject to corporate tax at the reduced rate ordinarily applicable to the Beneficiary Enterprise's income.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Tax exempt income generated under the Company's "Beneficiary Enterprise" program will be subject to taxes upon dividend distribution or complete liquidation. The entitlement to the above benefits is conditional upon the Company's fulfilling the conditions stipulated by the Investment Law and regulations published thereunder. Should the Company fail to meet such requirements in the future, income attributable to its Beneficiary Enterprise programs could be subject to the statutory Israeli corporate tax rate and the Company could be required to refund a portion of the tax benefits already received, with respect to such programs.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z18FC3E5B3ED741039A075630D6FA2139" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 27PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#160;c.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#160;&#160;Corporate tax rate in Germany:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 83.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The statutory corporate tax rate in Germany was 29.72%, 30% and 29.5% in the years 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 27PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#160;d.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">

</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Company and its subsidiary have not received final tax assessments since their incorporation, however, the assessments of these subsidiaries are deemed final through the 2012 tax year
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

</TD>

</DIV>
</TD>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z6E3DCA5FD2364A8D9148AD23941911B0" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 42PX; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#160;a.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	In December 2010, the Company, Teva and PolyHeal, entered into a series of agreements to collaborate in the development, manufacturing and commercialization of PolyHeal's wound care product, or the PolyHeal Product(&#8220; 2010 PolyHeal Agreement&#8221;).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z8CCEBBA596AD4D8B967179208B343FDF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company has accounted this transaction as an acquisition of a group of assets since the assets acquired did not constitute a business as defined in IFRS&#160;3. The Company allocated the consideration paid for the group of assets acquired based on their fair value to two identifiable assets: the license for the Polyheal Products in the amount of $&#160;6,333 and royalty rights arising from the Company's ownership of shares of PolyHeal in the amount of $&#160;417.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z90F30BE3544541C4B4E7E487306CA218" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
	The Company has been acknowledged during 2015 about certain changes in circumstances indicating that the carrying amount of its royalty rights arising from the Company's ownership of shares of Polyheal would not be recoverable. Accordingly, a full impairment of these royalty rights amounting to $417 is included within the loss from discontinued operation for the year ended December 31, 2015.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<HR STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ALIGN="CENTER" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z13B01DA01E2240BCB6C7480DC1B697AA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 54PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	NOTE 20:-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;SUPPLEMENTARY INFORMATION TO THE STATEMENTS OF&#160; PROFIT AND LOST AND OTHER COMPREHENSIVE LOSS
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 85.05PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35PT">
	a.&#160; &#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160; Cost of revenues:

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	MEDIWOUND&#160;LTD. AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<HR STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ALIGN="CENTER" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	U.S. dollars in thousands (except of share and per share data)
</DIV>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
